title: Creamy Baked Ziti
description: Ziti pasta bakes with layers of creamy tomato sauce and mozzarella cheese in an easy and comforting dish that's ready in less than an hour.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Everyday Cooking Creamy Baked Ziti 4.7 (131) 98 Reviews 61 Photos Ziti pasta bakes with layers of creamy tomato sauce and mozzarella cheese in an easy and comforting dish that's ready in less than an hour. Submitted by Kraft Updated on November 3, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 61 61 61 61 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 8 servings Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 4 cups ziti pasta, uncooked 1 (26 ounce) jar marinara sauce 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes, undrained 6 ounces PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese, cubed ¾ cup BREAKSTONE'S or KNUDSEN Sour Cream 1 (8 ounce) package KRAFT Shredded Mozzarella Cheese with a TOUCH OF PHILADELPHIA ⅓ cup KRAFT Grated Parmesan Cheese Directions Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Cook pasta in large saucepan as directed on package, omitting salt. Remove from pan; drain. Meanwhile, add marinara sauce, tomatoes and cream cheese to same pan; cook on medium heat 5 min. or until cream cheese is melted and mixture is well blended, stirring frequently. Return pasta to pan; mix well. Layer half the pasta mixture in 13x9-inch baking dish; cover with layers of sour cream, 1 cup mozzarella and remaining pasta mixture. Top with remaining mozzarella and Parmesan. Bake 20 min. or until heated through. I Made It Print 371 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Creamy Baked Ziti 01 of 61 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 61 Photo by  momonthego 08/22/2021 Adding hamburger for the guy. Very good. 03 of 61 Photo by  Will's Nona 06/14/2021 It’s excellent! 04 of 61 Photo by  RigaMortis27 04/13/2021 05 of 61 Photo by  duke3200 03/06/2021 06 of 61 Photo by  Jenica Davis 12/30/2020 07 of 61 Photo by  Heather Cole 11/05/2020 Delicious! Not long to make i made some edits. I added ground beef and mixed the sour cream with the sauce and layered. This 8s a good recipe l. Definitely will be saved as a favorite. 08 of 61 Photo by  Paige 09/27/2020 09 of 61 Photo by  Caryn Stevens 09/10/2020 10 of 61 Photo by  Caryn Stevens 09/10/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Baked Ziti Primavera 8 Ratings Best Ziti Ever with Sausage 57 Ratings Easy Mexican Chicken Spaghetti 33 Ratings The Best Baked Ziti 161 Ratings Vegetarian Bolognese with Soy Chorizo 1 Rating Easy Skillet Lasagna 15 Ratings Pepperoni Pizza Casserole 89 Ratings Bow Ties with Sausage, Tomatoes, and Cream 4,260 Ratings Baked Pasta 176 Ratings Penne with Asparagus and Mushrooms 73 Ratings Baked Ziti Casserole 63 Ratings Souper Skillet Pasta 80 Ratings Baked Ziti with Sausage 1,055 Ratings Italian Chicken Skillet 674 Ratings Baked Penne with Italian Sausage 785 Ratings Shrimp Primavera 99 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Kraft
instructions: Heat oven to 375 degrees F.;Cook pasta in large saucepan as directed on package, omitting salt. Remove from pan; drain. Meanwhile, add marinara sauce, tomatoes and cream cheese to same pan; cook on medium heat 5 min. or until cream cheese is melted and mixture is well blended, stirring frequently. Return pasta to pan; mix well.;Layer half the pasta mixture in 13x9-inch baking dish; cover with layers of sour cream, 1 cup mozzarella and remaining pasta mixture. Top with remaining mozzarella and Parmesan.;Bake 20 min. or until heated through.
